00003 /************************************************************************
00004  *                                                                      *

00140 //*********************************************************************************************
00141 // The following functions return parameters
00142 //
00143 // windowType:           Returns the time series windowing function type
00144 // frequencyPoints:      Returns an array of spectral frequency points
00145 // twoSidedFrequency:    Similar to above, but for a two-sided spectrum
00146 // twoSidedBandwidth:    Two sided power spectrum bandwidth. NOTE: must first call
00147 //                          meanIndexOf().
00148 // deltaFrequency:      Returns the spacing between frequency points
00149 // isPowerOfTwo:        Returns whether or not the input is a power of two
00150 //*****************************************************************************************
00151   int           windowType();
00152   int           calibrateMode()                 {return _calibrateMode;                 }
00153   float         *frequencyPoints()              {return _fft->frequencyPoints();        }
00154   float         *twoSidedFrequency()            {return _fft->twoSidedFrequency();      }
00155   float         twoSidedBandwidth()             {return _twoSidedBandwidth;             }
00156   float         deltaFrequency(int fftSize)     {return _fft->deltaFrequency(fftSize);  }
00157   LOGICAL       isPowerOfTwo(int n)             {return _fft->isPowerOfTwo(n);          }
00158 
00159 //*********************************************************************************************
00160 // The following functions calculate system parameters
00161 //
00162 // resolutionBandwidth:         Returns the resolution bandwidth in Hertz given the # of samples
00163 // frequencyFromIndex:          Returns the frequency corresponding to input array index
00164 // numberDataSamples:           Returns the number of data samples needed to achieve res bandwidth
00165 // nextFFTSize:                 Returns the next largest FFT size given the # of samples
00166 // indexFromFrequency:          Returns FFT array index corresponding to input frequency
00167 //*****************************************************************************************
00168   float         resolutionBandwidth(int numberSamples);
00169   float         frequencyFromIndex(float index);
00170   int           numberDataSamples(float resolutionBandwidth);
00171   int           nextFFTSize(int numberSamples);
00172   int           indexFromFrequency(float frequency);
00173 
00174 //*********************************************************************************************
00175 // The following functions calculate power spectrums
00176 //
00177 // powerSpectrum:               Non-windowed power spectrum, no averaging
00178 // psdFromAuto:                 Power spectrum from input autocorrelation
00179 // avgPowerSpectrum:            Windowed and averaged power spectrum
00180 // avgPowerSpectrum:            Windowed and averaged power spectrum using Chirp Z
00181 // avgPowerSpectrumFromReal:    Windowed and averaged power spectrum from real input data
00182 // avgPowerSpectrumFromReal:    Windowed and averaged power spectrum from real input data using chirp z
00183 //*****************************************************************************************
00184   float *powerSpectrum(float *input, int numberPoints);
00185   float *psdFromAuto(float *input, int numberPoints);
00186   float *avgPowerSpectrum(float *realInput, float *imagInput, int fftSize, int overlapSize, int numberAvgs,
00187                           int type=MAGNITUDE_IN_WATTS, int windowSize=0, LOGICAL initialize=YES,
00188                           int averageType=PSD_AVG);
00189   float *avgPowerSpectrum(float *realInput, float *imagInput, int inputSize, int overlapSize,           // Chirp Z
00190                           int numberAvgs, int numberOutputPts,
00191                           float startFreq, float endFreq, int type=MAGNITUDE_IN_WATTS,
00192                           LOGICAL initialize=YES, int averageType=PSD_AVG);
00193   float *avgPowerSpectrumFromReal(float *realInput, int fftSize, int overlapSize, int numberAvgs,
00194                                   int type=MAGNITUDE_IN_WATTS, int windowSize=0, LOGICAL initialize=YES,
00195                                   int averageType=PSD_AVG);
00196   float *avgPowerSpectrumFromReal(float *realInput, int inputSize, int overlapSize, int numberAvgs,     // Chirp Z
00197                           int numberOutputPts,
00198                           float startFreq, float endFreq, int type=MAGNITUDE_IN_WATTS,
00199                           LOGICAL initialize=YES, int averageType=PSD_AVG);
00200   
00201 //*********************************************************************************************
00202 // The following functions calculate phase spectrums
00203 //
00204 // phaseSpectrum:               Non-windowed phase spectrum, no averaging
00205 //*****************************************************************************************
00206   float *phaseSpectrum(float *realInput, float *imagInput, int numberPoints);
00207   
00208 //*********************************************************************************************
00209 // The following functions calculate complex spectrums
00210 //
00211 // complexSpectrum:             Non-windowed complex spectrum, no averaging
00212 //*****************************************************************************************
00213   void  complexSpectrum(float *realInput, float *imagInput, int numberPoints, LOGICAL windowData=0);
00214 
00215 //*********************************************************************************************
00216 // The following functions calculate autocorrelations
00217 //
00218 // autoFromPSD:                 Autocorrelation from input power spectrum
00219 // autocorrelationOf:           Time domain autocorrelation
00220 //*****************************************************************************************
00221   float *autoFromPSD(float *inputSpectrum, int numberPoints, int type, float *scale);
00222   float *autocorrelationOf(float *realInput, float *imagInput, int numberPoints, int windowLength,
00223                            int lagLength, int type, float *scale);
00224 
00225 //*********************************************************************************************
00226 // The following functions perform operations on autocorrelations and power spectrums:
00227 //
00228 // meanIndexOf:                 Finds the middle of a power spectrum array
00229 // maxBinFrequency:             Finds maximum bin frequency (see the PeakDetect class for better algorithms)
00230 // smoothSpectrum:              Smooths the input spectrum by using an averaging window
00231 // shiftRight:                  Circular shifts an array (PSD) right for 2 sided display
00232 // shiftRight:                  Circular shift for complex array
00233 // magnitudeToDB:               Converts watts to dB
00234 // normalizeAuto:               Normalizes autocorrelation function
00235 // complexToFloat               Converts a complex spectrum to floating point
00236 // oneSidedToTwoSided:          Converts the previously calculated spectrum from one-sided to two-sided
00237 //*****************************************************************************************
00238   float meanIndexOf(float *inputSpectrum, int numberPoints);
00239   float maxBinFrequency(float *inputSpectrum, int numberPoints, float flo, float fhi);
00240   void  smoothSpectrum(float *inputSpectrum, int numberPoints, int windowSize);
00241   void  shiftRight(float *inputArray, int shift, int arraySize);
00242   void  shiftRight(Complex *inputArray, int shift, int arraySize);
00243   void  magnitudeToDB(float *inputSpectrum, int numberPoints);
00244   void  normalizeAuto(float *autoc, int numberPoints, float scale);
00245   float *complexToFloat(Complex *inputArray, int arraySize, int conversionType);
00246   float *oneSidedToTwoSided();
00247 };
